events.message: The insured reported a car accident occurring at an intersection, resulting in significant damage to the vehicle's front end.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under 'Auto Accident' due to the description of the collision and vehicle involved.
An agent was assigned to the case promptly to ensure timely communication and management of the auto accident claim.
The insured received an official acknowledgment of their claim submission along with preliminary information on next steps.
The claims department requested photos of vehicle damage, police report, and driver’s license to proceed with investigation.
The insured submitted all requested documentation, including detailed photos of the car collision damage and official police report.
Investigation commenced focusing on assessing the extent of damages to the vehicle and verifying collision circumstances.
The investigation concluded with confirmation that the accident was in line with the claimant’s description and damages assessed.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover repair costs and associated expenses for the vehicle damage sustained in the accident.
The customer responded positively to the settlement proposal, expressing satisfaction with the responsiveness and clarity.
The claim was officially approved, confirming the settlement amount and authorizing payout for vehicle repair costs.
Payment to cover the approved settlement was issued and transferred to the insured’s designated account for repairs.
The claim was officially closed following receipt of payment by the insured and confirmation of repair arrangements.
